messages.message: anyone know why webapp `make build-docker` doesn't seem to copy the shared static files over? I updated my python deps, ran `make clean`. The webpack build runs and the files are in `webserver/shared/build/js/webpacked`, but they're not copied over to `webserver/webapp/build/py/static/js/webpacked`. I finally got it to work by manually changing the makefile to run compile-static-files and copy-static-files in the `build-docker` make command

build-docker shouldn’t be copying the webpack files. Maybe you can create a command called build-docker-local

Since we don’t run nginx locally (but we do run it in production), nginx actually serves those static files, but locally, webapp serves those static files
oh so you're saying for docker for local dev, you don't expect that to work? but how was it working before?
as in, if i start up instabase with karthik's provisioner script, then webapp won't host any static files?
